alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 7:34PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: Scattered light rain showers and a few thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts across areas in Carbon and Albany County will be possible over the next few hours. Gusty winds up to 55 mph are possible. Areas along Interstate 80 from Rawlins to Arlington, and locations along the Highway 130 and 230 corridor from Walcott Junction to the Colorado and Wyoming state line will also have the potential for strong wind gusts this evening. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
